intro: Lomatopodium lessingianum var. tenuifolium, commonly known as the slender-leaf lomatopodium, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and foliage with serrated margins. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, displaying a low, sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. This variety is distinguished by its smaller, more delicate foliage compared to other forms of Lomatopodium lessingianum.
